findings.title: ST - Stops Transactions
findings.description: The transactions are initially disabled for all users excluding the authorized addresses. The owner can enable the transactions for all users. Once the transactions are enabled, the owner will not be able to disable them again.

findings.title: US - Untrusted Source
findings.description: The contract uses an external contract to determine the transaction's flow, which is untrusted and may produce security issues.

findings.title: RAV - Router Argument Validation
findings.description: The contract does not validate the `_router` address that is passed as parameter to the `updateRouter` function. This lack of validation can lead to unintended behavior and potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: OCTD - Transfers Contract's Tokens
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to claim all the token balance of the contract by calling the `clearStuckToken` function.

findings.title: MEE - Missing Events Emission
findings.description: The contract performs actions and state mutations from external methods that do not result in the emission of events.

findings.title: RSW - Redundant Storage Writes
findings.description: The contract updates the isFeeExempt status of an account even if its current state is the same as the one passed as an argument. As a result, the contract performs redundant storage writes.

findings.title: MVN - Misleading Variables Naming
findings.description: Variables can have misleading names if their names do not accurately reflect the value they contain or the purpose they serve.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not adhere to the Solidity style guide, which may lead to decreased readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L13 - Divide before Multiply Operation
findings.description: Performing divisions before multiplications may cause loss of precision.

findings.title: L14 - Uninitialized Variables in Local Scope
findings.description: Using an uninitialized local variable can lead to unpredictable behavior and potentially cause errors in the contract.
